cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the SE Louisiana coast, then forecast to turn west and drift just offshore along the Louisiana coast toward the upper Texas coast before dissipating
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Morgan City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No active watches west of Intracoastal City LA; watches have been discontinued for the Texas coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City LA eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern and north-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama; outer bands and seas extending westward to the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (expected <2 ft along upper TX coast)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 mph possible Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along Galveston Bay and adjacent coast with persistent on-shore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could deliver 1–3 inches of rain Tuesday–Wednesday; localized street flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and dangerous rip currents for vessel approaches; isolated tornado risk in rainbands cannot be ruled out but is low this far west.
